result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dejun C Sanders-Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Dejun C Sanders-Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Defense requests a DPA hearing date Case adjourned, Branch 01.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Dejun C Sanders-Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1. 
Calendar call scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Dejun C Sanders-Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Atty. Wentz has received discovery and an offer and requests a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim and Victim wittness coordindator present.   Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz is requesting additional time to review discovery and the offer, requesting a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dejun C Sanders-Robinson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dejun C Sanders-Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with SS.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
